result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert James McGeshick Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert James McGeshick Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert James McGeshick Jr. was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Robert James McGeshick Jr. was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Robert James McGeshick Jr. was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Robert James McGeshick Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions, with no additional jail time.
Concurrent with: Count 8 but consecutive to jail sentence on 12CF147.
Any unpaid fines to be paid with 25% of any prison funds/wages due to the defendant and the remainder still due and owing following incarceration is to be paid thru ES.

Same conditions, no additional jail time.
Concurrent with: Count 8 but consecutive to jail sentence on 12CF147.
Any unpaid fines to be paid with 25% of any prison funds/wages due to the defendant and the remainder still due and owing following incarceration is to be paid thru ES,

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must obtain GED. 

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entering upon the premises of any bar or tavern.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes:
Huber and community service allowed.
Consecutive to: Jail sentence in case 12CF147

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert James McGeshick in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Defendant Robert James McGeshick in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:34 AM. Svehlek and McGeshick have received the revocation summary, points out error in regards to a release date but it has been corrected on the face sheet and states that sentence credit is correct. Court acknowledges the mistake and makes note of it. State makes final argument prior to recommendation - puts on the record that the defendant has 288 days credit on count #8 and is going to ask for time served on that count, on the remaining counts - asking for any time sentenced to to be consecutive to count #8 but concurrent to each other and concurrent to 17CM77. Court makes statement that there is no longer a sentence on 17CM77 as it was time served. State continues with its recommendation - recommends 7 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of ES on the remaining counts of #4, #7 and #9. Svehlek makes final argument prior to recommendation - recommends time served on count #8, on counts #4 and #7 - 4 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, concurrent to each other, with programming ordered, count #9 - recommends 2 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES - concurrent to counts #4 and #7. McGeshick withholds comment. Court wants statement made in 17CM77 to be incorporated into this case, sentences the defendant to the following: on count #8 - 365 days with credit for 418 days in FC jail (time served)- concurrent with 17CM77 - credit for 288 days; on counts #4, #7 an #9 will all be concurrent to each other and to count #8 and to 17CM77 - 7 years in WI State Prison System on each count consisting of 2.5 years of initial confinement followed by 4.5 years of ES - credit for 130 days, finds him eligible for programs, pay unpaid fines with any prison wages or funds due him and whatever is left following incarceration - make a condition of ES, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2018 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Requesting furlough for funeral. Approved for 2/12/16 only - release 10 a.m. and return before 7 p.m. Conditions: No consumption of alcohol and only to attend funeral services and related functions.
From defendant asking for furlough for death of family member. Granted by judge 8/25 to 8/29/15 at 6:00 p.m.

Defendant Robert James McGeshick in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:09 a.m. Also called 12CF147. State - 12CF147 here for Sentencing after revocation asking for 6 months jail. Schultz-  no inaccuracies in report but would like to clairify a few items in closing statement. 15CF31 - has resolution. Schultz - defendant would enter pleas to counts 4 & 7 and counts 8 & 9 would be amended to delete the repeater allegation, all other counts dismissed. Place on probation for 5 years concurrent with jail time, also recommending continuing treatment. State - also would like re-payment of $600 to FC drug taskforce. Schultz agrees. Defendant agrees. State indicates this is a joint recommendation. 

12CF147 - Counts 1 & 2 - 6 months FC jail on each count concurrent to each other, 116 days credit, huber and good time allowed. Right to appeal.

15CF31 - Defendant pleads guilty to counts 4, 7, 8 & 9 . Counts 8 & 9 are amended to delete repeater. Court goes over plea questionnaire and finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently enter his pleas and waived his rights. Court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State - makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation, jail time concurrent to 12CF147. Schultz makes final statement. McGeshick makes statement (remorseful). Court has considered all statements and documents filed. Court will accept joint recommendation. Court sentences to the following: Count 8 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail, huber and community service allowed, costs, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, must obtain GED, full time employment, must attend one AA/NA meeting per week, AODA and follow through with any recommendations, and $600 reimbursement to FC Drug Taskforce paid through probation. probation will be consecutive to jail time in 12CF147. Counts - 4, 7 & 9 with hold sentence and place on probation for 5 years - same conditions, no additional jail time. Costs on each count.  Right to appeal. Voting and firearms right given, must provide DNA sample with surcharges.
Final pre-trial at 06-24-2015 02:45 pm
Called 9:34 am. Robert McGeshick in person/custody and with attorney Schultz. State by JBC. Has information waives reading and pleads NG to all charges.
NMS
Arraignment at 05-21-2015 09:15 am

Called 2:15 pm. Robert McGeshick appears in person/custody and with counsel Attorney Hank Schultz. State appears by JBC. Schultz indicates waiver being filed for stated reasons. McGeshick agrees with statement of attorney Schultz. Court goes thru waiver and finds that defendant is waiving his right to PH freely, voluntarily and intelligently finds probable cause and binds over. Asks for ARGN date after 5/11/15. ARGN will be 5/21/15 @ 9:15 am.
Certificate of service-Deputy AC

Defendant Robert James McGeshick in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Defendant Robert James McGeshick in custody and appears via video from FOSO.   No appearence by State. Called at 9:03 AM. McGeshick and Schultz have complaint. Schultz has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but will waive time limits. Schuiltz - bond - signature bond but informs defendant not to sign it for stated reasons (P&P hold). Court sets bond at $2000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
